• Manage inventory, supplies, ticket queue, and documentation for a supported Google region. 
• Incident management for three site network outages and countless unforeseen popup projects.

-Work closely with Google product management and software engineering teams to improve Google products, and interact with QA teams to drive exceptional testing quality.

Summary I am a graduate of the Rochester Institute of Technology with a degree in Applied Networking and Systems Administration. I am currently working at Google Cambridge as a Corporate Operations Engineer. I also spent two years as an inaugural member of the Internal Technology Residency Program at Google in Mountain View, CA. I regularly provide exemplary IT support to Googlers via our walk up help desks called "Techstops", Tickets, and Chat. My position at Google also gives me the opportunity to work on many special projects, including live video streaming and networking. 
 
I am a motivated self starter who lives, breathes, and sleeps technology. Throughout my education I have worked as a freelance technician for small business and residential customers, doing computer, network, and A/V support and installation. 
 
My experience at Gemini Telemanagement Systems and Single Digits has provided me with extensive experience installing and maintaing HSIA (High Speed Internet Access) platforms at hotels across the country. These HSIA platforms included DSL and WiFi based connectivity in high utilization public environments. This position gave me an appreciation for properly documenting these systems during installation. Without extensive and accurate documentation the task of remote support becomes trivial at best. 
 
I have built my customer service experience throughout college by working for the RIT Finance and Administration department, supporting IT systems for the business functions of the institute. This involved supporting a large number of users, both via phone using remote access technologies and in-person. This position also enforced the importance properly documenting issues via a ticketing system and following up with users to ensure their issues are resolved. Summary As an IT Resident and Corporate Operations Engineer at Google I contribute to Google through in-person support across Linux, Windows, OSX, ChromeOS, Android and iOS platforms. I'm actively managing internal, globally-spanning projects, and contributing code and reviewing code in JavaScript, Python, HTML/CSS, Jinja templating, Google App Engine and Google Apps Script.  
 
I'm improving my programming knowledge and experience through self study, bug fixes and code contributions, and design contributions throughout all aspects of the application life cycle. Beyond coding I'm pursuing project management I'd like to learn more about Agile methodologies, particularly Scrum. 
 
Outside of my professional career I enjoy Martial Arts and frequently lead classes in Kickboxing, Kenpo, and self defense. Beyond teaching I compete in point fighting competitions and frequently travel to tournaments throughout the US. Summary Inquisitive, curious and fast learning Fieldtech Resident on the Internal Technology Resident Program at Google, based in Dublin. Recently graduated from my Computer Science with a 1st Class (Hons) from Aberystwyth University, which included an industrial year placement spent as a Fieldtech Intern at Google London - part of the front line IT support team.  
 
Enjoyed and enjoys learning about networking and hardware, as well as looking into the interaction between computers and the real world. Very interested in using the Raspberry Pi to interact with electronic sensors and outputs, and to make useful gadgets including: Pi Car (www.m517.co.uk/pi), AberCam (www.m517.co.uk/abercam) and other projects e.g a Pi powered door unlocker.  
 
Experience in Python, Java, SQL, PHP, XHTML, HTML5, CSS and JavaScript, small amount of meddling with Objective C, C++, Ruby on Rails and Bash.  
 
Eager and enthusiastic to learn new skills, Computer maintenance (Mac, Windows and Linux), friendly and warm attitude to handling customers. 
 
Enjoys Monty Python, motorsports and experiencing different cultures whilst travelling. Recently admitted to the Gild of The Freemen of Bridgnorth. See module information: http://www.aber.ac.uk/en/modules/deptcurrent/?m=CS25210 
Also see the game I made in that module when I took it: www.m517.co.uk/ministar Field Technician Intern Google July 2012  –  June 2013  (1 year) London Technical support for a huge, successful and active technology company is a big task. As a Corporate Operations Engineer, we are tasked with keeping Google and its Googlers moving which involves fixing problems on a wide variety of platforms and custom equipment from Ubuntu, Mac and Windows laptops to video conferencing equipment and smartphones.  
The majority of my time is spent providing direct support to our users, keeping their productivity at a maximum by keeping their downtime to a minimum and analyzing their requirements to further improve their efficiency.  
We provide a quick, friendly and personal service, and I take great pleasure in chatting with our diverse range of users about both their role inside the company as well as their current endeavors and expeditions.  
We also take part in larger projects that affect significant numbers of people, I particularly enjoy doing occasional server room work, and more frequent work with the Macintosh Operations Service Team. Summary I'm a recent Penn State graduate with multiple years of experience in IT support and a strong passion for technology and innovation. I graduated with a major in Information Sciences and Technology where I learned the critical nature of information systems in a business environment. My professional experiences include developing custom web applications with PHP/SQL to meet business expansion needs, consulting at KPMG to assess client IT security and compliance, and over three years of experience in IT support where I worked with multiple departments and customers at one of the nation's largest universities, in order to develop solutions to hardware, software, and network problems.  
 
Over the last eight years, I have worked with GNU/Linux for my daily computing needs and have become very proficient in its use. I have contributed countless hours of Linux support and testing via online forums and feedback. 
 
I have recently accepted an offer from Google to join their Internal Technology Residency Program where I will offer IT support to employees within one of the world's largest and most advanced computing environments. In this program, I will spend two years developing solutions to all types of computing problems across desktop, server, and mobile platforms and will spend a 3 month period contributing to a Google team that lines up with my future career goals.
